reviews.review: The sequel far surpasses this aging title now. Regardless, it was a well made and fun game for it's time.
The Most Fun Shooter on Steam
Un Exelente juego para entretenerte un buen rato

The Best Zombie Shooting Co-op Game Ever in the history of games

Luv it since childhood Back for more

This game was really fun when playing co-op. The big draw back is this game only works with a keyboard and mouse and you can't just have to local players without setting up a LAN to play. It would be best if controlers worked and a second player can enter the game by pressing start. After checking this out, I purchased Killing Floor 2 which resolved my controller issue.

You kill things as a funny british man (or a girl or a robot)


What more can you ask for?


Oh yeah you can insult other players too.

the game is quite enjoyable if you have friends to play it with,wich you should as it is a coop horde shooter.the main objective in killing floor is too make it through x waves and beat the boss,you can do this in multiple difficultys.
the max player number for an ordinary server in killing floor is 6,although people can modify servers that reach up to 100 people.
the weapon veriety in killingfloor  is massive reaching from pistols,axes,smgs and assault rifles to crossbows,snipers,swords and flamethrowers.
but what are guns without enemies to use them on,in killing floor you have enemies that reach from small and annoying to massive and very dangerous,the boss in the game is powerful but with a tough group you can  overcome him without much trouble.the maps in this game are truly its best part,some maps are big and open others smaller with tight corridors.however some maps are with flaws.the toymaster add on for the game adds some fresh air but becomes boring after a while.

Over all this game is an awesome horde based shooter and i would recomend it to anyone who like killing some zombies
9/10

Incrivel um dos melhores jogos que tem coop que ja joguei

One of two zombie games (the other being the L4D franchise) that have withstood the harsh climates of Steam public opinion and toxic development. And it all comes down to clearly defined objectives, an nifty perk system that justifies its grind to get it, an entertaining arsenal to fight back hordes of zombies, and a killer soundtrack. Though the game's community has been awesome in terms of content creation and general helpfulness, I think potential buyers are much better off supporting its latest entry. It has effectively built on the things that made the first so much fun to play, though it does lack many of the user-made campaigns that will surely follow.
The game is awful. It is unresponsive, buggy, and laggy. There are random time dialations, and the controls are unrefined.
If games were feelings this would probably be the worst hangover ever.
Much spoopier than the second game and still has active servers.

Probbaly the best (even if not the most fun) killing floor. Grimmy/dark/decay/apocalipse atmosphere,great zombies, everything.
Downsides: perks take an extreme amount of time to level up
Some perks have few weapons with other guns being dlcs.
Nobody actually plays this, all you'll find is some heavily modded servers thay barely have people playing.
